page.title: 12 Stubbers Green, Aldridge
page.content: Stubbers Green is an area of old mine and clay workings which over the years has become naturalised. It is a large stretch of land covered with ponds, streams and other points of interest. If I had my way I would try to preserve Stubbers Green as there are lots of wild animals there and if it was changed the would probably die out as they would have no where else to live. Although Stubbers Green is a wonderful place it could be better as there is pollution in some of the streams. The largest pond is used by Aldridge Sailing Club. On both ponds moorhens and coots are nesting and on the smaller pond swans have nested for several years. If the council built upon this land it would be a shame and a lot of animals and plants would be in danger.
